terms.name: contact affiliation
terms.value: Shanghai Key Laboratory of Regulatory Biology, School of Life Sciences, East China Normal University

description: Angelman syndrome (AS) is a severe neurodevelopmental disorder caused by maternal mutation and paternal imprinting of the gene encoding UBE3A, an E3 ubiquitin ligase. Although several potential target proteins of UBE3A have been reported, how these proteins regulate neuronal development remains unclear. We performed a large-scale quantitative proteomic analysis using stable-isotope labeling of amino acids in mammals (SILAM) on mice with maternal Ube3a mutation.

modifications.name: No PTMs are included in the dataset

terms.name: Dataset with no associated published manuscript

title: HAP1 is an in vivo UBE3A Target that Augments Autophagy in a Mouse Model of Angelman Syndrome
